benefits.description: Part A covers inpatient hospital stays, care in a skilled nursing facility, hospice care, and some home health care.

inpatientHospital.description: Semi-private room, meals, general nursing, and other hospital services and supplies

coinsurance: Days 91+: $816 coinsurance per lifetime reserve day

skilledNursingFacility.description: Semi-private room, meals, skilled nursing and rehabilitative services
skilledNursingFacility.requirements: Must have a 3-day qualifying hospital stay

hospiceCare.description: Pain relief, symptom management, and support services for the terminally ill

costSharing.copayment: Limited costs for outpatient drugs and respite care

homeHealthCare.description: Part-time or intermittent skilled nursing care and home health aide services

costSharing.requirement: Must be homebound and under doctor's care

benefits.eligibility: Automatically enrolled if receiving Social Security benefits at age 65
benefits.premium: Most people don't pay a Part A premium if they or their spouse paid Medicare taxes while working

benefits.description: Part B covers certain doctors' services, outpatient care, medical supplies, and preventive services.

doctorServices.description: Medically necessary doctors' services, outpatient medical and surgical services

preventiveCare.description: Services to prevent illness or detect it at an early stage

outpatientCare.description: Care you get in a doctor's office, clinic, or hospital outpatient department

medicalEquipment.description: Durable medical equipment like wheelchairs, walkers, hospital beds

benefits.eligibility: Must be enrolled in Part A or be 65 or older
benefits.lateEnrollmentPenalty: May pay a late enrollment penalty if you don't sign up when first eligible

benefits.description: Part C is an alternative way to get Medicare benefits through private insurance companies approved by Medicare.

includedServices.description: All Part A and Part B services, often includes Part D prescription drug coverage

network.description: Most plans have networks of doctors, hospitals, and other providers
types: HMO: Must use network providers except in emergencies
PPO: Can use out-of-network providers at higher cost
PFFS: Can see any Medicare-approved provider who accepts the plan
SNP: Special Needs Plans for people with specific conditions

costSharing.premium: Varies by plan, in addition to Part B premium
costSharing.outOfPocketMaximum: Plans must have a yearly limit on what you pay out-of-pocket

benefits.eligibility: Must have Part A and Part B, and live in the plan's service area
benefits.enrollment: Can enroll during Annual Enrollment Period (October 15 - December 7)

benefits.displayName: Medicare Part D - Prescription Drug Coverage
benefits.description: Part D helps cover the cost of prescription drugs, including many recommended vaccines.

prescriptionDrugs.description: Coverage for brand-name and generic prescription drugs at participating pharmacies
prescriptionDrugs.formulary: Each plan has a list of covered drugs (formulary)

vaccines.description: Vaccines including shingles and others not covered by Part B

costSharing.premium: Varies by plan (average $55 per month for 2024)
coverageStages: Initial Coverage: Pay copay/coinsurance until total drug costs reach $5,030
Coverage Gap: Pay 25% of drug costs
Catastrophic Coverage: Pay small copay or coinsurance after $8,000 out-of-pocket

benefits.eligibility: Available to anyone with Part A and/or Part B
benefits.lateEnrollmentPenalty: May pay a penalty if you go 63 days or more without creditable drug coverage

benefits.description: Original Medicare doesn't cover most dental care, dental procedures, or supplies like cleanings, fillings, tooth extractions, dentures, dental plates, or other dental devices.

originalMedicare.description: Limited to dental services related to covered medical procedures
examples: Dental exam before heart valve replacement

medicareAdvantage.description: Many Medicare Advantage plans offer dental coverage

standalonePlans.description: Separate dental insurance plans available for purchase
standalonePlans.consideration: Review coverage limits and waiting periods

benefits.recommendation: Consider supplemental dental insurance or Medicare Advantage plan with dental benefits

benefits.description: Original Medicare covers some eye care services and medical eye conditions, but not routine eye exams or eyeglasses.

partB.description: Covers eye exams and treatment for eye diseases and conditions
covered: Yearly eye exam for diabetic retinopathy for people with diabetes
Cataract surgery and one pair of glasses after surgery

costSharing.glasses: 20% of Medicare-approved amount for one pair after cataract surgery

medicareAdvantage.description: Many plans offer additional vision benefits
medicareAdvantage.costSharing: Varies by plan, often includes annual allowance

benefits.recommendation: Consider Medicare Advantage plan with vision benefits or standalone vision insurance

benefits.description: Medicare coverage for hearing services and hearing aids is limited.

partB.description: Covers diagnostic hearing and balance exams if ordered by a doctor
covered: Hearing tests ordered by doctor to determine if treatment is needed

medicareAdvantage.costSharing: Varies by plan, may include annual allowance for hearing aids

benefits.recommendation: If you need hearing aids, consider Medicare Advantage plan with hearing benefits or explore other coverage options
